meanings.definition: A member of the Praetorian Guard in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The pretorians protected the emperor in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent2: The pretorians were known for their loyalty and bravery.
meanings.sent3: The pretorians joked about their shiny armor during training.
meanings.sent4: The pretorians stood as steadfast as statues at the palace gates.
meanings.sent5: The pretorians' red cloaks billowed in the wind as they marched.

meanings.sent1: She was his most trusted pretorian, always by his side.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's pretorians ensured his plans were carried out.
meanings.sent3: The pretorians cheered on their team with unwavering enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: Her friends were like pretorians, ready to defend her at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The pretorians of the cause never wavered in their dedication.
